content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Define a regex to match markdown code blocks
    code_block_regex = r"^ *```julia\n((?:[^`]|`[^`])*?)\n```"ms

    # Use a regular expression search to find all occurrences of the code block in the markdown document
    matches = matchall(code_block_regex, md)

    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted julia code
    julia_code = ""

    # Iterate over each match and append the content inside the code block to the julia_code string
    for m in matches
        # Remove the leading and trailing whitespace from the matched text
        content = strip(m.match)

        # Remove the code fences (```julia and ```)
        content = replace(content, r"^```julia\n", "")
        content = replace(content, r"\n```$", "")

        # Append the content to the julia_code string with a newline between code blocks
        julia_code *= content * "\n"
    end

    return julia_code
end
```
